figures.name: Hannibal Barca
figures.note: Crossed Alps with elephants to attack Rome

figures.name: Christopher Columbus
figures.note: Found America but Vespucci named it

figures.name: Amerigo Vespucci
figures.note: America named after him. ITALIAN not Dutch.

figures.name: Roald Amundsen
figures.note: First to South Pole

figures.name: Marco Polo
figures.note: Venetian merchant, traveled to China, served Kublai Khan

figures.name: Isaac Newton
figures.note: Laws of motion, gravity, invented physics

figures.name: Charles Darwin
figures.note: HMS Beagle, Origin of Species, Galápagos finches

figures.name: Marie Curie
figures.note: Chemistry + Physics Nobel

figures.name: Nicolaus Copernicus
figures.note: Heliocentrism first, published on deathbed

figures.name: Galileo Galilei
figures.note: Proved heliocentrism, house arrest, 'And yet it moves'

figures.name: Alexander Fleming
figures.note: Discovered penicillin 1928 by accident, mold killed bacteria

figures.name: Sigmund Freud
figures.note: Psychoanalysis, unconscious mind, ego, Oedipus complex

figures.name: Euclid
figures.note: Wrote Elements, foundation of geometry. NOT Pythagoras.

figures.name: Pythagoras
figures.note: Pythagorean theorem (a² + b² = c²), NOT Elements

figures.name: Socrates
figures.note: Hemlock, taught Plato, 'I know that I know nothing'

figures.name: Plato
figures.note: The Academy, The Republic

figures.name: Aristotle
figures.note: The Lyceum, taught Alexander the Great

figures.name: Confucius
figures.note: Ethics focused on respect, hierarchy, social harmony

figures.name: Friedrich Nietzsche
figures.note: God is dead, Thus Spoke Zarathustra, German

figures.name: René Descartes
figures.note: Cogito ergo sum, Cartesian coordinates

figures.name: Karl Marx
figures.note: Communist Manifesto + Das Kapital, class struggle

figures.name: Leonardo da Vinci
figures.note: Mona Lisa, flying machines, anatomical drawings

figures.name: Michelangelo
figures.note: Sistine Chapel, David statue

figures.name: Raphael
figures.note: School of Athens. R=Room full of philosophers

figures.name: Sandro Botticelli
figures.note: Birth of Venus, Primavera. B=Birth of Venus

figures.name: Vincent van Gogh
figures.note: Starry Night, ear, Post-Impressionism

figures.name: Pablo Picasso
figures.note: Cubism ✅, Guernica ❌ still. G=Genocide on canvas. P=Pictures in cubes

figures.name: Homer
figures.note: Iliad, Odyssey - foundation of Western literature

figures.name: William Shakespeare
figures.note: Hamlet, Macbeth, Romeo and Juliet

figures.name: Dante Alighieri
figures.note: Divine Comedy - Hell, Purgatory, Paradise

figures.name: Leo Tolstoy
figures.note: War and Peace, Anna Karenina

figures.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
figures.note: Crime and Punishment, Brothers Karamazov (psychological, dark)

figures.name: George Orwell
figures.note: 1984, Animal Farm, real name Eric Blair

figures.name: Miguel de Cervantes
figures.note: Don Quixote, first modern novel

figures.name: Sun Tzu
figures.note: The Art of War

figures.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
figures.note: Went deaf, 9th Symphony, Ode to Joy

figures.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
figures.note: Child prodigy from age 5

figures.name: Winston Churchill
figures.note: WWII, blood toil tears sweat

figures.name: Mahatma Gandhi
figures.note: Nonviolent resistance, freed India from British

figures.name: Vladimir Lenin
figures.note: Bolsheviks, founded Soviet Union

figures.name: Henry VIII
figures.note: 6 wives, broke from Catholic Church

figures.name: Elizabeth I
figures.note: Virgin Queen, defeated Spanish Armada

figures.name: Cleopatra
figures.note: Greek (Ptolemaic), NOT Egyptian

figures.name: Joan of Arc
figures.note: French, 17, divine visions, burned at stake

figures.name: Marie Antoinette
figures.note: French queen, guillotined, never said 'let them eat cake'

figures.name: Mehmed II
figures.note: Conquered Constantinople 1453, ended Byzantine Empire

figures.name: Constantine the Great
figures.note: Edict of Milan 313 AD, legalized Christianity, built Constantinople

figures.name: Martin Luther
figures.note: 95 Theses, Protestant Reformation

figures.name: Johannes Gutenberg
figures.note: Printing press 1440

figures.name: Thomas Edison
figures.note: Lightbulb, 1000+ patents, DC current

figures.name: Nikola Tesla
figures.note: AC current, rival of Edison

figures.name: Florence Nightingale
figures.note: Crimean War, founded modern nursing (NOT Red Cross)

figures.name: Henri Dunant
figures.note: Founded Red Cross, first Nobel Peace Prize

figures.name: Augustus/Octavian
figures.note: First Roman Emperor, adopted son of Caesar. NOT Constantine.

figures.name: Wright Brothers
figures.note: First powered airplane flight, Kitty Hawk 1903

figures.name: Archimedes
figures.note: Eureka! Water displacement. War machines vs Romans. 'Don't disturb my circles.' Syracuse/Sicily.

figures.name: Niccolò Machiavelli
figures.note: The Prince. Better feared than loved. Machiavellian = cunning/ruthless.

figures.name: Rembrandt van Rijn
figures.note: The Night Watch. Master of light/shadow. 80+ self-portraits. Dutch Golden Age. Rem=remarkable light.

figures.name: Hippocrates
figures.note: Father of Medicine. Hippocratic Oath: 'First, do no harm.' ~400 BC Greek.

sessions.notes: First full session. Strong on scientists, philosophers, conquerors.
80 questions (1 skipped). Locked: Michelangelo, Nietzsche, Vespucci, Mehmed II, Tolstoy/Dostoevsky distinction.
Session 4. Cervantes, Socrates, Beethoven now locked. New: Homer, Picasso, Constantine, Euclid. Missed: Botticelli vs Raphael, Euclid vs Pythagoras, Fleming, Constantine.
Session 5. Quick 5Qs. All correct including Galileo/Inquisition.
Session 6. Descartes locked (cogito+Cartesian). Euclid/Pythagoras distinction locked. Botticelli locked. Missed: Raphael (School of Athens), Vespucci nationality (Italian not Dutch).
Session 7. Raphael/Fleming redeemed. Botticelli/Marx leveled up. NEW: Archimedes, Machiavelli, Rembrandt, Hippocrates. Still sticky: Guernica, Vespucci nationality, Constantine details, Kublai Khan.
